page.title: 12ENERGY IN FINZEAN.
page.content: {Peat}is no longer cut and stored but much{wood}is burnt tho' becoming more expensive since families can no longer gather a year's supply of fallen wood.Merchants operate and logs cost from Â£30-Â£40 per tractor load.Stoves may also be fuelled by{coal products} or oil,used for cooking and to heat radiators throughout the home.Others prefer an open fire in the family room and electric or calor gas heaters elsewhere,cooking on gas or electric cookers.Larger buildings may have {oil-fired or calor gas}central heating and a few homes are all{electric.} Farm and forestry machinery is driven by{diesel oil}and all local cars use {petrol.} Until recently oats were ground at the Mill of Clenter by{water power,2}water wheels being still in use nearby.
